meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny -!

Hey there, fellow gamers! Are you ready to embark on a thrilling adventure that will test your wit, courage, and (mostly) patience? Then buckle up, because Wizardry: Proving Grounds of the Mad Overlord is here to transport you back in time to an era when dungeon crawlers were the stuff of legend.

As I delved into this remade classic, I couldn't help but think of the old-school RPG veterans out there who will appreciate the nostalgic value and punishing gameplay experience. It's like Digital Eclipse took a page from the original game's playbook and said, "Hey, we can make this even better – with modern graphics and a hint of new-fangled flair!"

Now, I know what you're thinking: "What about those pesky critics who say it's too hard or limited in its mechanics?" Well, let me tell you, fellow gamers, some things are worth the challenge. Wizardry is a game that demands strategy, planning, and – most importantly – resilience. If you're not prepared to die... a lot... then maybe this isn't the game for you.

But hey, even the critics had their praise! Hardcore Gamer thought it was "a solid choice" for old-school RPG fans, while IGN Italia called it "a competent remake." Multiplayer.it praised its "great remake of a great classic," although they did mention that it might be too hard for modern audiences. And SECTOR.sk... well, they found it to be a pleasant reminder and memory, but with less convincing gameplay.

So, what's the verdict? Well, I'll leave that up to you. If you're ready to take on the challenge of a lifetime (or at least a few dozen hours of gaming), then Wizardry: Proving Grounds of the Mad Overlord is waiting for you. Just don't say I didn't warn you...

That's it for this review, folks! Keep on gaming, and remember – Hippo Penny is always here to guide you through the wild world of video games!
